content:
⚠ Modified the contribution.
Comment: Changed 'loose' to 'lose' in all occurences. 'Loose' means 'not tight', 'lose' means 'to fail to win'.

Nice clash. :) I just got it in Reverse mode, managed to solve it in 4:14. I had a feeling it was related to Monty Hall, but I ended up just solving it based on the patterns I observed.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good way to have players do probabilities !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting question...  Probability and stuff.

Concerned that this doesn't explain that (1) a contestant chooses a door, then (2) Monty Hall reveals another door that has a goat behind it. This means if someone hasn't heard of this particular game show they'd have to research it. I feel like clarifying this would make it more fair for folks who haven't watched the Monty Hall show.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's interesting to include probabilities in the coding games.

Title
* Should "Monthy" be revised to "Monty"?

Goal
* Please change "firstly selected" to "selected first".

* Please change "loosenDoor" to "looseDoor" for consistency.

* Please change "monty" to "Monty".

* Please change "has the most probability to has the car" to "with the highest probability that the car is behind it".

* Please change "each doors to get the car" to "each door behind which is the car".

Input
* Please change "<<First line:>>" to "<<Line 1>>: An integer".

* Please change "firstly" to "first".

* Please change "<<Second line:>>" to "<<Line 2>>: An integer".

* Please change "<<Third line:>>" to "<<Line 3>>: An integer".

* Please change "monty" to "Monty".

Output
* Please change "<<First line:>>" to "<<Line 1>>:".

* Please change "has the most probability to has the car" to "with the highest probability that the car is behind it".

* Please change "<<Second line:>>" to "<<Line 2>>:".

* Please change "to get the car" to "behind which is the car".

* For less confusion, please require players to show 2 decimal places for all the probabilities.

Constraints
* This section is to limit the cases that the players should be expected to handle. It is not for expanding on the output requirements or the rules. Hence, please move the first four and the last three items to Output section.

I will comment again after you have followed up as above as I need to see the result first.

Thanks.

Thank you. Please further follow up as follows:

Output
* Line 1: Please add "indexes of the" before "doors with".

* Line 1: Please add ", sorted in ascending order and separated by a space. 1-based indexing should be used." after "behind it". Remember to include the comma.

* Line 2: Please add ", truncated to 2 decimal places and separated by a space" after "which is the car". Remember to include the comma.

Goal
* Please delete the last six lines (starting from "proba is an element…").

Thanks again.
